Members of Auckland’s exclusive Northern Club want Philip Polkinghorne banned https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/philip-polkinghorne-faceing-calls-for-ban-from-fellow-members-of-aucklands-exclusive-northern-club/673BIOPN6ZBQBH6QINOTE4VB5A/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/philip-polkinghorne-faceing-calls-for-ban-from-fellow-members-of-aucklands-exclusive-northern-club/673BIOPN6ZBQBH6QINOTE4VB5A/ Carolyne Meng-YeeKC claims Polkinghorne has breached the rules, brought club into disrepute. Sat, 05 Oct 2024 16:00:00 +0000 Philip Polkinghorne has been a longstanding member of the Northern Club. Some members want him banned for his drug convictions.
Three people missing after car plunges into river in Marlboroughhttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/third-people-missing-after-car-plunges-into-river-in-marlborough/LQWEQLMS2BBXTCQFEHQ46OKEVE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/third-people-missing-after-car-plunges-into-river-in-marlborough/LQWEQLMS2BBXTCQFEHQ46OKEVE/ The car had five occupants, and only two have been accounted for.Sat, 05 Oct 2024 18:45:16 +0000 The intersection of State Highway 1 and Bush Road, Tuamarina, where a car with five occupants plunged into the river overnight. Revealed: Why WorkSafe NZ dropped a landmark prosecution against police over death of Head Hunter Taranaki Fuimaono in custody https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/revealed-why-worksafe-nz-dropped-a-landmark-prosecution-against-police-over-death-of-head-hunter-taranaki-fuimaono-in-托管/HCN36G3G2BH5XIP7DH33PHEQGU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/revealed-why-worksafe-nz-dropped-a-landmark-prosecution-against-police-over-death-of-head-hunter-taranaki-fuimaono-in-托管/HCN36G3G2BH5XIP7DH33PHEQGU/ Jared SavageDeath of Taranaki 'Ardie' Fuimaono will be investigated by IPCA and Coroner instead. Sat, 05 Oct 2024 16:00:00 +0000 More than 300 mourners attended the funeral of Taranaki 'Ardie' Fuimaono, inset, a Head Hunters gang member who died in police custody in June 2021. WorkSafe prosecuted the police over alleged health and safety breaches but have now withdrawn the charge. Image / NZME
Royal New Zealand Navy vessel HMNZS Manawanui runs aground near Samoa https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/royal-new-zealand-navy-vessel-hmnzs-manawanui-runs-aground-near-samoa/YLJL2634NVDJTD6YOQPJDBOMFU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/royal-new-zealand-navy-vessel-hmnzs-manawanui-runs-aground-near-samoa/YLJL2634NVDJTD6YOQPJDBOMFU/ Cherie HowieThe incident took place near Samoa, the New Zealand Defence Force said. Sat, 05 Oct 2024 17:25:21 +0000 The Royal New Zealand Navy ship HMNZS Manawanui is used for salvage and hydrography tasks around New Zealand and across the Southwest Pacific, according to the New Zealand Defence Force's website. Photo / NZDF
Christopher Luxon and ‘rich prick’ politicians can’t win when it comes to property – Heather du Plessis-Allan https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/christopher-luxon-and-rich-prick-politicians-cant-win-when-it-comes-to-property-heather-du-plessis-allan/NKOTHNQ6JFCEJEKCIOHCYFDIMQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/christopher-luxon-and-rich-prick-politicians-cant-win-when-it-comes-to-property-heather-du-plessis-allan/NKOTHNQ6JFCEJEKCIOHCYFDIMQ/ Heather du Plessis-AllanOPINION: Conspiracies around Luxon's house sale are much sexier than the boring truth. Kāinga Ora bans elderly tenants from happy hour drinks https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/pensioner-party-poopers-kainga-ora-bans-elderly-tenants-from-their-happy-hour-drinks/A6KGFPGKQJBIZI2CG4N2G2SIXY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/pensioner-party-poopers-kainga-ora-bans-elderly-tenants-from-their-happy-hour-drinks/A6KGFPGKQJBIZI2CG4N2G2SIXY/ Ben LeahyTenants claim a big night drinking for them ends by 8.30pm but Kāinga Ora wants it banned. Earthquakes: Can a warning system save New Zealand from the Big One? https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/earthquakes-can-a-warning-system-save-new-zealand-from-the-big-one/3U3LM56BWNHTLBAJD227OV7MDU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/earthquakes-can-a-warning-system-save-new-zealand-from-the-big-one/3U3LM56BWNHTLBAJD227OV7MDU/ Jamie MortonNZ doesn't yet have an earthquake early warning system, but scientists are paving the way. Sat, 05 Oct 2024 18:35:07 +0000 Willow Woolrich and her classmates at Napier's Ahuriri School take part in a nationwide 'Shake Out' earthquake drill in 2021. Scientists have been exploring earthquake early warning tech that could give Kiwis crucial seconds to prepare before shaking starts. Photo / Warren Buckland
